welcome: Welcome to Mathigon! I’m Archie, your personal tutor.
account: You can create a free account to save your progress.
tutorial1: Our content is divided into small steps. You have to complete the activities to reveal what’s next.
tutorial2: We will save all your progress, so you can come back later and continue right where you left off.
correct: Well done
Great Work!
Way to go!
incorrect: That’s not quite right
Are you sure about that?
That doesn’t look right.
Try again!
serverError: Sorry, I can’t help at the moment. Check your internet connection or try again later.
wrong-chart-1: Are you sure? If the price is higher, fewer people will want to buy a skateboard – so the demand is lower.
wrong-chart-2: That doesn’t look right. As the price increases, the number of people who want to buy a skateboard decreases.
calculator: You can use me as calculator. Simply tap on my head, type an expression, and hit enter.
intro-1: Substitute the expressions for revenue, cost and demand we found above.
intro-2: Make sure you correctly multiply all brackets.
intro-3: You have to simplify the right-hand side of this expression, until it only contains price as variable.
